title: Artificial Life Institute
subtitle: University of Vienna
body: We investigate lifelike dynamics, synthetic ecologies, and the principles that let complex systems adapt and persist.\\nOur work connects computation, biology, robotics, and philosophy to build systems that feel alive.

title: About the Institute
body: The Artificial Life Institute at the University of Vienna advances theory and experimentation across scales, from protocells to collectives.\\nWe build bridges between disciplines and cultivate a rigorous, creative research culture.

title: Research Focus
body: We design, simulate, and observe systems where life-like behavior emerges. Our core themes:
bullets: Origins of life and open-ended evolution|Artificial chemistries and morphogenesis|Embodied collectives and swarm intelligence|Synthetic ecosystems and digital ecologies

title: Projects & Platforms
body: We run long-horizon projects that blend computation, wet lab exploration, and public-facing engagement:
bullets: Autonomous protocell platforms|Open-source simulation toolkit|ALife seminar series|Citizen-science evolver

title: Contact
body: Start a collaboration, join our events, or discuss research directions.
